alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:49PM EDT until April 11 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County. Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County. Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ada affecting Kent County. Grand River at Grand Rapids affecting Kent County. Looking Glass River Near Eagle affecting Clinton County. .Another round of heavy rain has fallen across Lower Michigan. Rainfall totals in the last 24 hours are around 1.5 inches across much of the Grand River basin. This will worsen and prolong the high water conditions that many areas are already experiencing, and bring additional locations above flood stage over the next few days. Generally dry weather will prevail through the weekend, so once this water works through the rivers the water levels should finally start to drop. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River at Lowell. * WHEN...From Thursday evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowell fairgrounds flooded, low sections of Bowes Road, Division, Front Street, and Jackson flooded in the city of Lowell. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 17.0 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 10/03/1986. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
